field.title: Pulse
field.subtitle: Cosmic, Earth & Body rhythms
field.lunarExplanation: The moon's visible portion reflects gravitational position. Waxing phases indicate increasing illumination toward full moon; waning indicates decrease toward new moon.
field.lunarNote1: Phase cycles new → waxing → full → waning over ~29.5 days
field.lunarNote2: Illumination shows percentage of visible surface
field.lunarNote3: Combined with other signals to shape daily echoes
field.solarExplanation: The sun's position shapes the light cycle and influences circadian rhythms. Sunrise begins the brightening phase; sunset marks the transition to rest.
field.solarNote1: Solar phase indicates sun position: Morning (rising), Midday (highest), Afternoon (descending), Night (below horizon)
field.solarNote2: Sunset marks transition to evening phase
field.solarNote3: Used alongside lunar and coherence signals
field.coherenceExplanation: Coherence measures collective sentiment alignment synthesized from global news sources and contemplative observatories. Higher values indicate more unified collective patterns across regions.
field.coherenceNote1: Coherence above 60% indicates aligned collective sentiment
field.coherenceNote3: Synthesized from global news and contemplative sources
field.coherenceNote4: Part of echo card relevance calculation
field.geoExplanation: The Kp index measures disturbance in the Earth's magnetosphere. Higher values indicate stronger geomagnetic storms from solar wind interaction.
field.geoNote4: Affects magnetosphere and potential auroral displays
field.bodyExplanation: Circadian rhythms are your body's internal 24-hour clock. They influence alertness, hormone levels, and cognitive performance throughout the day.
field.dataFromInputs: Data generated using real-time inputs from:
field.bodyIndicator: General indicators based on circadian patterns
field.obsSecondaryPeak3: Creative and physical energy often present
field.timingDefault: Timing guidance based on current conditions
field.timingNote1: Timing suggestions based on current lunar phase and circadian rhythms
field.timingNote2: Adjust based on personal energy patterns
field.timingNote3: Consider local sunrise and sunset times
field.timing_solar_energy_supports_focused_cre: Solar phase often linked with creative focus
field.timing_quarter_moons_bring_clarity_to_de: Quarter phases traditionally linked with review and clarity
field.timing_new_moon_energy_supports_fresh_st: New moon phase often observed during new cycles
field.timing_waning_gibbous_moon_with_quiet_ge: Waning gibbous moon with quiet geomagnetic field
field.timing_releasing_energy_supports_clearin: Waning phase traditionally associated with release
field.pausedMessage: Pulse is paused. Continue with full access to explore rhythms.

learn.title: Wisdom
learn.subtitle: Patterns beyond the personal — across media, culture, and time.
learn.globalConsciousnessDesc: A 7-day view of the global conversation
learn.signalBeneathNoise: Media patterns after removing noise, conflict loops, and reactive content
learn.methodologyIntro: Every article passes through a multi-stage filter before it reaches you.
learn.methodologyStep1: First, obvious noise is removed — clickbait, sensationalism, content too brief to carry meaning.
learn.methodologyStep2: Then, each article is evaluated by AI for contemplative depth, cultural wisdom, community impact, environmental awareness, and universal themes.
learn.methodologyStep3: Only articles scoring 7 out of 10 or higher make it through — most are deliberately filtered out.
learn.methodologyStep4: Articles rooted in ancient traditions, indigenous knowledge, or consciousness practices receive extra weight.
learn.methodologyStep5: Accepted articles get a deeper analysis — producing the scores, themes, and patterns you see here.
learn.methodologyLegendTitle: What remains falls into three patterns:
learn.methodologyReactive: Conflict, fear, division — framing that provokes rather than informs.
learn.methodologyObservational: Neutral, factual reporting — without strong narrative framing.
learn.methodologyIntegrative: Solutions, connection, understanding — community initiatives, breakthroughs, reconciliation.
learn.methodologyLandscape: Media Landscape shows the overall breakdown across all articles.
learn.methodologyIntegrationQuality: Integration Quality rates only the integrative articles for depth and cross-perspective awareness.
learn.methodologyHope: Hope Level reflects how much solution-oriented possibility is present — from Low to Very High.
learn.methodologyTrend: 7-Day Trend shows how the overall balance has shifted over the past week.
learn.methodologyClosing: This doesn't judge truth or bias — just how stories are framed. No account needed, nothing about you is tracked or stored.
learn.consciousnessUnavailableDesc: Media Climate data is being updated. Please check back later.
learn.ancientWisdomDesc: Daily insights from ancient calendar traditions
learn.cookieDisclaimer: The echo outlives the voice that made it.
learn.fieldQuiet: The field is quiet here. Try again later.
learn.calExplainerGregorian: The civil standard, tracking the solar year.
learn.calExplainerMayan: A sacred count of 260 days, weaving time and destiny.
learn.calExplainerChinese: Tracks months by the moon, corrected by the sun.
learn.calExplainerHebrew: Lunisolar rhythm aligning festivals with seasons.
learn.calExplainerIslamic: Pure lunar count, drifting through the solar year.
learn.calExplainerHindu: Integrating celestial observations with spiritual timekeeping.
learn.calDetailGregorian: Established in 1582, the Gregorian calendar divides time into 365 days with leap years every 4 years. It's the international standard for civil use, based on the solar cycle.
learn.calDetailMayan: The Tzolkin weaves 13 numbers with 20 day names in a sacred 260-day cycle. Mayans believed this reflected cosmic rhythms and human consciousness—used for spiritual guidance and timing ceremonies.
learn.calDetailChinese: Combining lunar months with solar corrections, the Chinese calendar maintains harmony between celestial cycles. Each year cycles through 12 animals, each associated with elements and personality traits.
learn.calDetailHebrew: Balancing lunar observation with solar precision, the Hebrew calendar aligns festivals with seasons while honoring the moon's cycles. Deeply spiritual, it marks sacred time through seasonal celebrations.
learn.calDetailIslamic: Following the pure lunar year of 354 days, the Islamic calendar shifts 11 days earlier each solar year, creating a complete cycle every 33 years. This cycle reconnects observers to the original revelation.
learn.calDetailHindu: The Panchang integrates multiple calendric systems—solar, lunar, and stellar cycles—into a comprehensive framework used for auspicious timing of ceremonies and spiritual practices across Hindu traditions.
learn.defaultLivingSummary: A natural cycle flowing through time.
learn.calendarDefault: A system for understanding time cycles.
learn.seasonalPatternSummary: The light is shifting as we approach the solstice threshold.
learn.seasonalPatternWhy: We are approaching the turning point.
learn.cookieSubtitle: A fictional reflection for quiet contemplation
learn.cookieFictionalDisclaimer: This is fictional content generated for reflection, not guidance.
learn.livingCalendarDesc2: Indigenous time systems and ceremonial timing
learn.oralTraditionDesc2: Indigenous weather prophecy, dream time, and plant medicine timing
learn.sacredGeographyDesc: Places of spiritual significance across cultures, from sacred mountains to ceremonial sites.
learn.oralTraditionDesc: Stories and teachings passed down through generations, carrying ancestral knowledge.
learn.seasonalRhythmsDesc: Natural cycles of the year, from solstices to equinoxes, as observed across traditions.
learn.pausedMessage: Wisdom is paused. Continue with full access to explore patterns.
